channel.title: The Driver's Edge Photo Gallery
channel.description: Scroll through photos of the latest and greatest photos from the automotive industry

item.title: 2019 Volvo V60 Is A Classy Wagon That Doesn't Skimp On Practicality
item.author: Tyler Heatley
item.description: Offering style and substance, the new midsize premium wagon is ready to give the Germans a hard time.

media:content.media:title: Seeing the Volvo v60 Wagon
media:content.media:description: "SUV" has become the automotive buzzword over the past few years with the fashion conscious class invading almost every driveway. What ever happened to the trusty, and ever practical, wagon? Volvo hopes it new V60 will capture the attention of dog owners and fashionistas alike.

media:content.media:title: Seeing the Volvo v60 Wagon
media:content.media:description: It’s a looker isn’t it? Unlike dominant German rivals, the V60 ditches sharp creases in favor of flowing lines and generally more sculpted physique. Volvo’s signature Thor hammerhead headlights make a return on this wagon, as does a broad chromed grille. Overall the car presents a sophisticated and elegant alternative to SUV alternatives.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Volvo v60 Wagon Revealed
media:content.media:description: Inside you’ll find a cabin that won’t be mistaken for an Audi or BMW. A minimalist design comes curtesy of a large portrait touchscreen that has absorbed most of the switchgear. Air conditioning, navigation, media, it’s all housed in this 9.0-inch display. Swedish style flows into the rear where passengers will find good levels of head and leg room, although the middle occupant will have to contend with a sizeable transmission hump.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Volvo v60 Wagon Revealed
media:content.media:description: "SUV" has become the automotive buzzword over the past few years with the fashion conscious class invading almost every driveway. What ever happened to the trusty, and ever practical, wagon? Volvo hopes it new V60 will capture the attention of dog owners and fashionistas alike.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Volvo v60 Wagon Revealed
media:content.media:description: "SUV" has become the automotive buzzword over the past few years with the fashion conscious class invading almost every driveway. What ever happened to the trusty, and ever practical, wagon? Volvo hopes it new V60 will capture the attention of dog owners and fashionistas alike.

media:content.media:title: Seeing the Volvo v60 Wagon
media:content.media:description: "SUV" has become the automotive buzzword over the past few years with the fashion conscious class invading almost every driveway. What ever happened to the trusty, and ever practical, wagon? Volvo hopes it new V60 will capture the attention of dog owners and fashionistas alike.

media:content.media:title: Seeing the Volvo v60 Wagon
media:content.media:description: "SUV" has become the automotive buzzword over the past few years with the fashion conscious class invading almost every driveway. What ever happened to the trusty, and ever practical, wagon? Volvo hopes it new V60 will capture the attention of dog owners and fashionistas alike.

media:content.media:title: Seeing the Volvo v60 Wagon
media:content.media:description: Volvo is aiming for all of its cars to feature some form of electrification by 2019 and so the new V60 has two gasoline plug-in hybrid options. The most potent T8 hybrid produces 385 horsewpoer. There’s also a range of conventional gasoline and diesel engines to accompany the plug-in cars.

media:content.media:title: Seeing the Volvo v60 Wagon
media:content.media:description: "SUV" has become the automotive buzzword over the past few years with the fashion conscious class invading almost every driveway. What ever happened to the trusty, and ever practical, wagon? Volvo hopes it new V60 will capture the attention of dog owners and fashionistas alike.

What ever happened to the trusty, and ever practical, wagon? Volvo hopes it new V60 will capture the attention of dog owners and fashionistas alike.

media:content.media:title: Seeing the Volvo v60 Wagon
media:content.media:description: Practicality is a high priority for any estate car and so this V60 is equipped with a large trunk and flat load bay. 529 liters of space makes it 99 liters bigger than the outgoing car, and actually more spacious than a BMW 3 Series Touring, Audi A4 Avant, and Mercedes-Benz C-Class Estate. Fold the rear seats flat to grant 1,364 liters of cargo space.

media:content.media:title: Seeing the Volvo v60 Wagon
media:content.media:description: Practicality is a high priority for any estate car and so this V60 is equipped with a large trunk and flat load bay. 529 liters of space makes it 99 liters bigger than the outgoing car, and actually more spacious than a BMW 3 Series Touring, Audi A4 Avant, and Mercedes-Benz C-Class Estate. Fold the rear seats flat to grant 1,364 liters of cargo space.

Fold the rear seats flat to grant 1,364 liters of cargo space.

media:content.media:title: Seeing the Volvo v60 Wagon
media:content.media:description: Volvo is well known for its safety tech and so the V60 is packed with its latest advances. City Safe will automatically apply the brakes if it detects an imminent collision and the semi-autonomous Pilot Assist system will keep you in your lane. With all that, in tandem with a vast array of airbags, we’d expect the V60 to claim the full five stars from Euro NCA

item.title: Ferrari 488 Pista Officially Revealed With More Power, Less Weight
item.author: Adrian Padeanu
item.description: After a couple of massive leaks, the Ferrari 488 Pista is finally here to steer you away from buying a Porsche 911 GT2 RS.

item.title: 2018 BMW X2 First Look: Not So Fastback
item.author: Collin Woodard
item.description: A "new breed of car" that sure looks a lot like a small crossover

media:content.media:title: 2018 BMW X2
media:content.media:description: It’s been about two years since we first saw a disguised BMW X2 prototype on the road. Since then, it’s been teased relentlessly and even caught essentially undisguised. Today, though, BMW officially revealed the X2.

media:content.media:title: 2018 BMW X2
media:content.media:description: It’s been about two years since we first saw a disguised BMW X2 prototype on the road. Since then, it’s been teased relentlessly and even caught essentially undisguised. Today, though, BMW officially revealed the X2.

item.title: 2019 Volkswagen Arteon: Chicago 2018
item.author: Drew Phillips
item.description: We’ve been admiring the good looks of Volkswagen’s CC replacement, the Arteon, for nearly a year now—from afar, that is. But now VW has finally announced U.S.-market information for the 2019 Arteon, and it doesn’t appear to be at all dumbed down compared to the Europe-market version that has been on sale for a while now.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Volkswagen Arteon: Chicago 2018
media:content.media:description: We’ve been admiring the good looks of Volkswagen’s CC replacement, the Arteon, for nearly a year now—from afar, that is. But now VW has finally announced U.S.-market information for the 2019 Arteon, and it doesn’t appear to be at all dumbed down compared to the Europe-market version that has been on sale for a while now.

item.title: Lamborghini Launches Urus SUV, Gives It 641 HP To Play With
item.author: Sergiu Tudose
item.description: Lamborghini has officially re-entered the SUV sector, as their brand new, high-performance Urus SUV looks ready slay any and all opponents in its segment.

media:content.media:title: Lamborghini Launches Urus SUV
media:content.media:description: With 641 HP and 627 lb-ft (850 Nm) of torque at its disposal, the Lamborghini Urus is able to hit 62 mph (100 km/h) in 3.6 seconds, 124 mph (200 km/h) in 12.8 seconds, and a top speed of 190 mph (305 km/h). A plug-in hybrid option will be available later on.

media:content.media:title: Lamborghini Launches Urus SUV
media:content.media:description: With 641 HP and 627 lb-ft (850 Nm) of torque at its disposal, the Lamborghini Urus is able to hit 62 mph (100 km/h) in 3.6 seconds, 124 mph (200 km/h) in 12.8 seconds, and a top speed of 190 mph (305 km/h). A plug-in hybrid option will be available later on.

item.title: New Toyota FT-AC Concept Is A Macho Compact SUV For Adventurers
item.author: Carscoops
item.description: Toyota has revealed the Future Toyota Adventure Concept (FT-AC) at the LA Auto Show, a design study aiming at people looking for a proper rugged crossover. Described as a design study for now, the new Toyota FT-AC is imagined as a gasoline-powered SUV with an advanced torque-vectoring all-wheel-drive system, and the company adding that it could switch to a next-generation hybrid system.

item.title: 2018 Mazda6 Gets 250 HP Turbo Treatment, New Interior For LA Debut
item.author: Christopher Smith
item.description: Mazda says the new Mazda6 is re-engineered, but looking at the company’s 2018 flagship sedan, it doesn’t seem much different than the outgoing model. It’s true that, at a glance, it’s the same attractive mid-sizer turning the front wheels, with stats that still match up to the outgoing model. That is, all stats save for the one labeled horsepower, provided you opt for the new SKYACTIV-G 2.5 T engine. In case you’re wondering, the T stands for turbo.

media:content.media:title: 2018 Mazda 6
media:content.media:description: Mazda debuted the new Mazda6 at LAAS. It is set for production and release beginning in 2018.

media:content.media:title: 2018 Mazda 6
media:content.media:description: Mazda debuted the new Mazda6 at LAAS. It is set for production and release beginning in 2018.

item.title: Top-of-the-line 2018 Buick Regal TourX costs $43,795
item.author: Drew Phillips
item.description: Buick has unveiled an online configurator for the 2018 Regal TourX wagon, and it shows that picking the full suite of premium options puts the sport wagon at $43,795. That prices it under its Regal GS Sportback sibling and competitors like the Volvo V60 Cross Country and Audi A4 Allroad. The luxury hatchback starts at $29,995 and is available in three trim options: TourX 1SV, Preferred ($33,575) and Essence ($35,945). All are powered by a 2.0-liter turbocharged four-cylinder engine that puts out 250 horsepower and 295 pound-feet of torque and drives an eight-speed automatic transmission. Intelligent all-wheel-drive with active twin-clutch, start-stop technology and 18-inch painted aluminum wheels are also standard.

item.title: 2019 Corvette ZR1 Convertible Is Rightfully One Of LA’s Hottest Debuts
item.author: Drew Phillips
item.description: General Motors' 755-horsepower Corvette ZR1 supercar will have a starting price of $119,995, with the convertible version from $123,995, its global product development chief, Mark Reuss, said on Tuesday.

media:content.media:title: 2019 Corvette ZR1 is GMs 755-horsepower supervette

item.title: 2019 Mercedes-Benz CLS revives the straight six
item.author: Joel Stocksdale
item.description: It's finally here, the third generation of the car that popularized the four-door coupe design, the Mercedes-Benz CLS. This 2019 model replaces the version that first appeared in production form way back in 2010. Compared with that car, the new CLS looks much cleaner and leaner. The look-at-me rear fender creases have vanished, the nose and tail straightened out, and the extra-wide grille and lights sit low in the front fascia. What remains is a high belt line and rakish roof. Overall, it might be a tad less distinctive, but more mature.

media:content.media:title: The New 2019 Mercedes-Benz CLS
media:content.media:description: The new CLS looks much cleaner and leaner. The look-at-me rear fender creases have vanished, the nose and tail straightened out, and the extra-wide grille and lights sit low in the front fascia. What remains is a high belt line and rakish roof. Overall, it might be a tad less distinctive, but more mature.
